normally if you have a floating tremolo it means that the point where it sits is
dictated by the tension on on on the strings counteracted by the tension of a string uh of a spring and those two if
they're equal it sits at a certain spot the problem with that being if you break a string all of your other strings are
Out Of Tune because the tension on them changes now what Ken Ken Parker did with this is there is a blade spring that
sits in here with this wheel you can adjust that balance point and on the back of the guitar there is a slide
switch and that switches this tremolo into a um floating mode and a down Bend
only mode and the thing is the spring can't pull the bridge back past the
point where it disengages and what you do with this wheel is you set your balance point to be the exact same point
